content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
There are no complete composite structures successfully built on the map. The agent’s efforts have focused on establishing a research support facility and supporting processing units, though none have finalized as an installed structure.

• Lab for Research Supply at Position (0.5, 2.5)
 – Intended Use: To supply Automation Science Packs for research (Logistics Science Pack technology).
 – Details: Multiple attempts were made to locate, craft, and place a Lab here. However, errors in inventory verification and resource shortages prevented the Lab from being successfully placed.

• Iron Smelting Furnace at Position (5.0, 5.0)
 – Intended Use: To smelt iron ore into iron plates for support of lab component production.
 – Details: An alternative furnace was retrieved and used in processing operations. Although it contributed to iron plate accumulation, it remains an isolated operational facility rather than an agent‐constructed composite structure.

• Copper Smelting Furnace at Position (–27.0, –60.0)
 – Intended Use: To convert harvested copper ore into copper plates for use in copper cable production, which is a prerequisite in the Lab crafting chain.
 – Details: A copper furnace was identified and utilized for smelting, thereby boosting the available copper plate count. Its operation supports downstream production but is not part of a larger assembled structure.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• API Usage and Argument Errors
 – Avoid using unexpected keyword arguments (e.g., “radius”) with get_entities(). Verify the function’s signature and pass only supported parameters.
 – Ensure positional arguments match the API’s expectations to prevent errors regarding argument count.

• Handling Non‐Iterable Returns
 – Validate that API calls (such as get_entities()) return an iterable object. When a None value is possible, incorporate a fallback (for example, converting it to an empty list) before performing any iteration.

• Lab Placement and Crafting Failures
 – Confirm that the necessary Lab item exists in the inventory before attempting placement to avoid “No lab in inventory” errors.
 – Prior to crafting, ensure that all required sub-ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, electronic-circuits, and copper-cables) are available. Verify that the complete production chain is in place, including the ability to produce precursors (iron plates, copper plates) using available processing facilities.
